comments:
From Eclipse-dev:

I sometimes have problems with the Ant Editor in Eclipse.
On save it pops up an error dialog that tells me something like:
"Save Failed: null"

The log gives the following exception that looks like an incompatible 
log4j-Version to me:

I have the Lomboz-Plugin installed, that also installs an 
org.apache.log4j plugin

Any Hints appreciated...

Greetings,
    Malte

To clarify:

I don't have a classpath environment variable set in my system.
I'm running Sun JDK 1.4.2_04 on Windows XP professional.

I have a standalone installation of Ant 1.6.1 and I have set the environement
variable ANT_HOME to point to it.

I added my jdk's tools.jar and the junit.jar to the Ant classpath under "Ant
Home Entries". The jdk's tools.jar is also included under "Global Entries".
Other than that I didn't change the Ant classpath.
I there a way to print out the classpath that ant uses when running?

I installed the lomboz J2EE-Plugin (see: www.objectlearn.com) Version 3.0.1 that
brings an org.apache.log4j_1.2.8 plugin along.

Thanks.
Does the save problem happen on any buildfile or only one in particular?
Can you reproduce the problem on demand or is it random failures?
Can you supply a buildfile that can reproduce the problem?

The Bug is not 100% reproducible. It does happen very often, though.
I only work with one buildfile at the moment that shows the behaviour.

I sent the buildfile to "Darin_Swanson@us.ibm.com"

Malte,

I have not been able to reproduce this problem. Are you still having issues or 
have anything further to add to this bug report?
unable to reproduce. Please reopen if still experiencing problems.

Small test case showing similar problem:

<project>
	<target name="Jar_all" description="Jar all classes that are needed by 
Exercise Timer project.">

		<classfileset id="reqdClasses" dir="bin">
			<root 
classname="ca.tonge.exerciseTimer.ExerciseTimer" />
		</classfileset>

		<!--<property name="reqd" refid="reqdClasses" />-->

		<echo message="reqd=${reqd}" />
	</target>
</project>

It is the setting of the property "reqd" to the classfileset that is causing 
problems here.

The generalized problem is the handling of exceptions/errors when configuring 
task nodes.

Changes to the AntPropertyNode and AntDefiningTaskNode (and 
AntModelMessage.properties).

Basically there are cases where a linkage error will occur attempting to 
defined properties (only known case is the classfileset reference) or define 
tasks that have conflicting versions of libraries on the classpath.

Verified.
Please update the build notes.
